heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 06 September 2025 and continued for 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (178°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 56.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1754 miles.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 15477 lux), cloud levels (up 818 m), and pressure (up 9 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 14107 lux), cloud levels (up 951 m), and feels like temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 818.0m lower than yesterday, 138.8m lower than the past week, 951.1m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 737m and a high of 4780m, averaging 1575.8m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and little or no wind. Chance of light rain, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and overcast conditions will limit sunlight. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
